reviews.text: My friend's and I wanted to have a girls night in before my best friend got married. We chose to stay at GBC and it was a wonderful experience. The staff were accommodating, the food was great, and the room and the views were amazing, even with a storm in the area. We stayed in a 2 bedroom family suite overlooking the pool and the beach, and enjoyed every minute of it! One night was not enough!

reviews.title: Loved Grace Bay Club
reviews.text: My husband and I celebrated our 7th wedding anniversary at the Grace Bay Club (9/28-10/2/06). All we were looking for on this trip were great beaches, great restaurants, but most importantly TOTAL RELAXATION (as an ALL ABOUT US type of thing) since we were leaving our very active 4.5-year-old son with family. We're very happy to report that Provo and the Grace Bay Club delivered.

reviews.title: Trip was good until we dined at Anacaona - hidden jewel
reviews.text: Upon our arrival at the resort, we were greeted with a wet towel and a drink. We sat in the beautiful lobby while an employee checked us in. He then proceeded to show us around the resort before taking us to our room. We spent the rest of our first afternoon at the beach, marveling at how blue, calm and clear the water is and how soft the sand is.

reviews.title: A wonderful Grand Hotel !
reviews.text: This resort has just grown from 20 odd suites to about 50 odd suites and i have to say they have done a great job in preserving the small luxury feel of the hotel. The beach/ocean front accomodations (of which all of them are)have an uncluttered feel which is excellent, and the beach....well, it has to be one of the best in the world. The people here are wonderful - always trying to go above the call of duty - extremely friendly and accomodating, it's really like visitng family. You will see the managment team in action at all times, i even asked the charming GM if he ever went home to sleep. We really enjoyed the two restaurants and i have to advise all of you to try the chocolate gourmandis, as it is to die for! The beach staff need special mention as they really made us feel that we were in paradise! Overall we were very impressed at where they have come in just 3 months of opening the new villas, they still have a few minor kinks to sort out,but we are confident that they will do so. A sure 10 out of ten on our list and we have been to many great resorts in the carribean like the 4 Seasons, Cap Jaluca etc!

I have to say I was skeptical with all the mixed reviews posted. But after spending time on Provo and checking out the different resorts on Grace Bay, the layout of GBC is definitely the nicest--great use of the space, spread out. The other resorts--Palms, Point Grace, etc.--are all clustered together. At GBC, you step out onto your oceanfront balcony and you feel as if you are all alone--great! Stayed at the Hotel, which definitely needs work. Was told that they are completely renovating 3/06-12/06. Construction everywhere on Grace Bay, not just here, so be aware if you go off season. Thankfully there was no bulldozing going on during our stay but the Villa directly next to the Hotel was being finished. Plans to build the Estates (to the east of the Hotel) go into effect in 2007.
reviews.title: Service? what service?
Stayed on the Island, ate at the Hotel, enjoyed the lounge for drinks
reviews.text: And I definitely thought the Anacoana was the prettiest, especially at night. And the food was very nice, nothing spectacular, but I don't think it paled in comparison to Palms or Point Grace. About equal. The Lounge is wonderful too--live music, peaceful. But when we were there (3rd week Dec), the entire island was pretty quiet. Their continental bkft and afternoon teas are great.

We spent a very enjoyable week at Grace Bay Club this Spring with our two young kids. There is no question that this resort offers the best food I have ever had in the Caribbean. The service was quite impressive for island service, though I did not adore our personal concierge who did not respond so promptly to requests and did not seem terribly interested in us. That said, he did always come through in the end and made nice dinner suggestions to us locally. We did not ask for much more, so it was just fine.

reviews.text: Grace Bay Beach is really divine, and Grace Bay Club has a very nice set up on the beach. The pools are very good as well. Although I did not find the rooms anything more than average, we were comfortable, happy, and loved the view.

reviews.text: What a perfect place for adults to relax while teens have a great time! Watersports are included, and our teens kept busy with sailing, kayaking, paddle boarding and windsurfing. Many thanks to Morley (water sports staff) for his incredible patience teaching my nephew to windsurf. Morley spent at least two hours instructing, even paddle boarding alongside and "rescuing" with kayaks and sailboats when my nephew had trouble turning around for shore. What a patient, hardworking guy!
